Description: Handle-plate sherd of North Ionian Late Wild goat Style pottery column-krater, with part of handle; cream slip; on top of plate, two tendrils with buds separated by three horizontal bars; on rim, two narrow bands and tips of rays; edge of plate black; reserved on underside; exterior of handle black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA15 and Oxford, G119.48 and 1966.1024.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 36, pl. 25, no. 25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.300)
